intro: Racosperma binatum, commonly known as the two-seeded racosperma, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features trifoliate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its pods are typically slender and contain two seeds, giving it its common name. Racosperma binatum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
